title: Finance and Education in Entrepreneurship
headline: Learn how to find investors and raise funds for a start-up as an entrepreneur in this free online finance course.
description: Do you know what options are available for entrepreneurs to help them raise funds and find investors? This finance course goes through the available options and shows you how to explore opportunities in your own country. We study the link between entrepreneurship and education and explain how to leverage your knowledge to set up a new company. Financing can be a massive block for entrepreneurs so let this course do the hard work for you.

courseDescription:
Raising finances is a tricky business but once you know how and where to start, your battle is half over. This finance course teaches you how to explore and exploit every possible opportunity to raise funds and get your business off the ground. You will learn about entrepreneurial odds, the ‘financing staircase’, some aspects of start-up investor interest and the trending themes in funding. We also explain the ‘funding pyramid’ and how management helps firms to cross-scale barriers from nano to mega.

The course then studies the link between education and entrepreneurship. These two fit hand in hand and we show you how to identify the opportunities available to those with the relevant information. We help you learn how to use what you have to achieve your start-up goals. The course investigates the idea of ‘entrepreneurial odds’ for start-ups and establishes what is required to take the leap of faith it takes to set up a business 

We then examine the different types of available enterprises and their various funding models. ‘Going public’ is an interesting concept and the course takes you through initial public offerings and what to look out for. Finally, we look at financial strategy and explain how to develop your own. Let this finance course guide you through the murky waters of entrepreneurship and help you find the light at the end of the tunnel.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.details: Raising Finances and Developing Financial Strategy
modules.description: This module outlines the available options for entrepreneurs to access funds, the policy frameworks and other supportive options. Also, it explains how to raise finances; especially when start-up founders set up their companies with very scarce or meager resources.
topics: Raising Finances and Developing Financial Strategies- Learning Outcomes
Raising Finances and Developing Financial Strategies - Lesson Summary

modules.name: Module
modules.description: This module explains how an individual's education can be leveraged in setting up entrepreneurial and start-up firms. Also, it explores the linkage between entrepreneurship and education. You will learn about how entrepreneurship is boosted with management, science and finance for Start-up transformation.

modules.name: Module
topics: Finance & Education in Entrepreneurship - Course Assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes
  • Upon completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Define financial strategy
    • List out the factors that influence financial decisions
    • Identify entrepreneurial odds
    • Identify the six types of enterprises
    • Explain the meaning of Angel funding
    • Explain how investors limit the freedom of Start-ups
    • Explain the meaning of crowdfunding
    • Identify the Emerge ITP Platforms
    • Identify the economic and business factors relevant for financial strategy

  • Definition of Financial Strategy

  • Lesson Summary
    • Entrepreneurial odds are: conceptualization of the product or service, arrangement of the finance, assembling of the team, establishment of the project, development and providing of the product/service, delivery of the product/service and finally earning of reasonable returns
    • Some investment destinations are: e-commerce, digital logistics, fintech, application of digital
      technology into medical and health care matters
    • There six types of enterprises and they are: Nano, micro, small scale, medium scale and mega enterprises
    • Angel funding means high network individuals who are committed to investing in early Start-ups either individually or through Angel Networks
    • Incubator support are infrastructure platforms that make available plug and play facilities, co working space, legal and patenting support as well as mentoring to Start-ups
    • EMERGE platform is an integrated institutional trading platform for start-ups and small and medium enterprises which do not have their securities listed on any recognized stock exchange and which seek listing of the specified securities exclusively on the said platform for informed investors, it is the credible platform because it is supported by National Stock Exchange and it can be done with or without IPO
    • Crowdfunding is the process of raising funds online through small donations from a large number of people in the internet
    • Financial strategy of a firm is a set of integrated financial goals and activities planned for a firm, covering multiple domains of the company so that the firm can grow profitably, maximizing value for its shareholders
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon completion of this course, you should be able to:
    • Explain the interplay and interaction between education and entrepreneurship
    • Explain the purpose of education
    • Explain the importance of education and how it helps entrepreneurship
    • Describe student entrepreneurship
    • Identify the options for STEM graduates
    • Explain STEMEM as a collaborative paradigm
    • Identify the strategies to support science and technology
    • Explain how entrepreneurship is boosted with management
    • Identify examples of science based Start-ups

  • Indias Scientific, Technological and Professional Growth

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Indias Scientific, Technological and Professional Growth

  • Indias Scientific, Technological and Professional Growth

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Start-up Focus on Innovation Drives Change

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Start-up Focus on Innovation Drives Change

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary
    • Liberalization means that we not only import and absorb the technologies, but also innovate by ourselves so that we are competitive in the global marketplace
    • Innovation comes about through science and technology, efficiency comes about through engineering and mathematics, competitiveness comes about through enterprise and management
    • STEM means Science Technology Engineering and Mathematics
    • The real purpose of education is to enhance creativity, enhance innovation, improve management, and enhance enterprise in individuals
    • Entrepreneurship is very much dependent on the relationship between our creativity, passion between innovation and commitment on one hand and the ability to create a product or service and deliver effectively in the marketplace
    • Student entrepreneurship means the ability for a student to convert all of his knowledge, all of his experimental knowledge into a product or a service which is developed and offered to an industry
    • Good management practice is one which provides scale and which provides sustenance. And a bad management is one which has failure or lack of profitability, lack of viability
    • The way in which we can encourage entrepreneurship is to convert the mindset from job-seekers to job creators and the whole employment and retirement system should have flexibility and fluidity to encourage entrepreneurship at any point of time in one's career, including post retirement
